content: On YouTube you can find a series of lectures Feynman did in New Zealand. The first lecture is about how light is definitively a particle. But the best part of that particular lecture is at the very end when he answers questions from the audience. By this point he really had his “light” spiel down, and yet when he was simply ad libbing answers to questions he was even better. Also, have you ever noticed that the most interesting parts of any book about other 20th century physicists is always where they talk about Feynman? Even Gell-Mann keeps telling Feynman stories, though it seems to irritate him no end.
